SENT.plain: The distribution of HLA A, B, C, DR antigens was investigated in a British population with ulcerative colitis
Fifty six patients were typed for HLA, A, B, C and 46 additionally for DR
No association was found between the HLA phenotype and the presence or absence of ulcerative colitis
Serum from 52 patients was tested for the presence of the anticolon antibody
There was no relation between the presence of the antibody and the HLA phenotype
Finally, no correlation was found between the HLA phenotypes, the age of onset of the disease, the extent and the clinical course
